conclusion: The magnetic induction strength is: B=5×10^{-3} T.
The charge-to-mass ratio is: q/m=2×10^{6} C/kg.
The distance from the origin to the particle source is: d=1.2 m.
The angle of incidence is: θ=48.5°.
The sine of the angle is: sin 48.5°=0.75.
The expression for the radius of the circular path of the particle is given by: r=mv/qB.
The expression for the distance from the origin to the point where the particle hits the collection device is given by: d=r sin θ.

premise: Substituting the values of r and sin θ into the equation d=r sin θ.
Rearranging the equation d=mv/qB sin θ to solve for v.
Substituting the given values into the equation v=qBd/m sin θ.
Simplifying the equation v=2×10^{6} C/kg × 5×10^{-3} T × 1.2 m / 0.75.
